title: Drawing, "Design for Sofa and Mirror, Portrait Room, Royal Palace, Warsaw, Poland", ca. 1766
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, rose watercolor on cream laid paper
provenance: Hippolyte Destailleur (sold, Paris, May 19, l898, no. 103 for 185 francs; (ref. H. Mireur, "Dictionnaire des Ventes d'Art," Paris, l911, Vol. IV, p. 148); Léon Decloux (bought after l906).
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: A sofa with two end seats separated by gaines from the central section; a double-headed spread eagle, top center, from which festoons hang toward the bottom of the mirror frame, topped by a canopy with feathers; above, curtains are held up by putti crouching at the corners; a circular medallion under the canopy contains the monogram SIR, referring to King Stanislas Augustus II of Poland (l732-1798).

participants.person_name: Stanislas Augustus II, King of Poland

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Design for Sofa and Mirror, Portrait Room, Royal Palace, Warsaw, Poland", ca. 1766.
ca. 1766. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, rose watercolor on cream laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-68.
